project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: The JIRA admin context multi-select widgets show the currently selected projects grouped at the end/bottom of the list, but the GH context widget shows them selected in alphabetical order with the the unselected projects.
fields.summary: Make admin context selection consistent with JIRA

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
* To view the version description popup in the GH portlet you must hover over an (i) symbol.
* To view the version description popup in the GH PLANNING BOARD you must *click* a circle to the left of the version label.

Perhaps, at the very least, the GH PLANNING BOARD should act on hover so that people find the feature rather than act on click for an element that is not obviously clickable.
fields.summary: Make version description popup viewing consistent

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Recipe:

* Create an issue ISSUE-1.
* Create a sub-task of ISSUE-1.
* Assign ISSUE-1 to fix version FVA via the GH PLANNING BOARD.
** The sub-task moves with the parent.
* Drag the sub-task from FVA to fix version FVB.
** The parent issue remains in FVA.
* In FVB try to drag-n-drop rank the sub-task alongside other issues in the same fix version
** You won't be able to move the issue because it still behaves like it is anchored to it's parent.

Admittedly it is a little odd to separate the child and parent.
fields.summary: Cannot rank sub-task if in different version than parent

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hi,

We use the TASK BOARD for our daily stand up meeting. In that meeting screen real estate is very important, we want to be able to see as many issues as possible. As such we would like a view that does excludes anything above the version drop down box line and anything below the columns ("Powered by ..." etc)

Anything else that also increases the value of the available screen space by allowing more issues to be seen also falls under this screen, so this includes [List mode in TASK BOARD|GHS-456] for example. Other ideas include:

* Compact the space between adjacent cards.
* Reduce the minimum card height for a given row of cards based on how much summary text they have. (i.e. don't include unnecessary vertical white space in the cards)

Thanks,

Ximon
fields.summary: "Full Screen" TASK BOARD view

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: ... Not just the version label text.
fields.summary: The entire top bar of a PLANNING BOARD version box should be clickable

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
See attached Wink video.

Recipe:
* TASK BOARD
* Double click a card or click 'Cards'
* Click the pencil to the right of the issue summary text on the card

The card will now go blank.
fields.summary: Clicking the summary edit pencil on the detail card view on the TASK BOARD doesn't work

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: We are using a custom field of type Select List. When editing the issue with Jira, we are correctly presented with a dropdown list to chose a value. However, in the Planning Board with the Cards view selected, when editing this field we are presented with an edit box where free text can be entered.
fields.summary: A custom field of type Select List doesn't appear as a dropdown on the card

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently when you 1st go into Greenhopper and have not yet selected a Version to display in the Task Board/Planning Board or Chart board, Greenhopper defaults to the 1st entry in the Version list.  This takes an extremely long time to display if you are using child and parent versions because the 1st item on the list is a Parent version (which has tons of issues), yet 99.9% of the time what you want to view is the Child version which corresponds to your Sprint and only focus in on the work being done now or soon.

So this request is for Greenhopper to display the lowest child version by default and NOT the 1st item in the version list.  If the customer is not using child versions, then of course the lowest child version will still be the 1st item in the list.  But in our case, where we have 10 sprints under a "Version 1.5" master version, and when GH selects Version 1.5 which causes GH to try to display graphs, task boards or planning pages with nearly a thousand Jira issues.  Yuck! :) 

Even better, it would be great if the Planning board would default to Unscheduled (if a Version has not already been selected previously).  After all planning is about focusing on the work to come, not the work in process, or work in the past.
fields.summary: To save time and DB thrashing, switching to Planning/Task/Chart board should select a child version by default, not a parent version

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When hours are entered for the first day of the sprint at 12:00 AM, they will not show up in the burndown chart.  But if you click "Chart Data", the resulting spreadsheet will show the hours correctly (and the burndown hours there are different than those displayed on the chart).

It seems that for the burndown chart, the divide between previous sprint and current sprint is 12:00:00 / 12:00:01, while the dividing line for the Chart Data is 11:59:59 / 12:00:00.

Deleting the hours and reentering them for any day/time combination other than 12:00 AM on first day of sprint will make them display correctly in the chart.
fields.summary: Burndown chart can miss entered hours that show on Chart Data

:)

fields.description:
Hi,

I noticed today in GH 2.4 that when viewing the chart I see a Chart Data download link only for the HOUR BURNDOWN CHART, not for the custom field chart types etc.

I don't know if this is a bug or an improvement. I suspect it is just what has been implemented so far and so I am creating an improvement request.

Cheers,

Ximon
fields.summary: Make chart data available for more chart types than just HOUR BURNDOWN CHART

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hi,

I previously had a discussion with GH support about the confusing nature of the release version dialog. Today I encountered the problem again, my colleagues were even more confused than I was.

The dialog should either:

1) Have a drop down box and then have two buttons "Release & Swap" and "Release and do NOT swap".

OR

2) The text on the 2nd button should say "Release but DO NOT swap" instead of "Release anyway".

The existing design of embedding the swap to version drop down box inside the "Release and swap" button is very unclear.
fields.summary: Re-design the release version dialog

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The GH [Planning Board views documentation|http://www.greenpeppersoftware.com/confluence/display/GH/PLANNING+BOARD#PLANNINGBOARD-options] says:

{quote}The unreleased versions are sorted by release date or JIRA sequence, if none has been defined. {quote}

However, I have a mix of versions with and without release dates and a version that is sorted to the top of the JIRA sequence but has no release date does not appear at the top of the GH views.

Note: I can force my desired behaviour by setting a release date in the past.
fields.summary: Version ordering doesn't obey order defined in manage versions screen

fields.description:
It should be possible to "flip" cards to show the back of the card, perhaps use the arrow <> notation used by MSN Messenger for profile cards?

Use case: You have an acceptance criteria field and want to show it on the back of the card. It would be nice if the text could be made to fill the whole area of the back of the card.

I think listing acceptance criteria on the back of cards is quite normal in Scrum, e.g. see:

  http://blogs.decadesoftware.com/hlarledge/2008/03/whats-on-your-t.html
  http://www.agile-software-development.com/2008/01/user-stories-answers-on-postcard-please.html
fields.summary: Show fields on back side of cards

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: We've found a problem in GreenHopper where if I am looking at the task board with the fix version context set to a master fix version (e.g. fix version "Milestone 1" that has child fix versions "Sprint 1", "Sprint 2") and I click and drag an issue from "TO DO" to "IN PROGRESS", my context switches from "Milestone 1" to whichever child version the issue I moved belongs to (e.g. "Sprint 2").  This behaviour seems strange as I would expect my context to remain the same when I click and drag issues on the task board.  It is confusing to see issues disappear all of a sudden when I move an unrelated issue into a different column.
fields.summary: Context switches when moving issues around in task board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: In the Planning Board, one can view the issues by Versions, Components, or as an Overview. When viewing the issues by Versions, we need to be able to filter the issues by Components. Thus, we need to have the field Components in the Custom Filter window.
fields.summary: Component as a field for a Custom Filter

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Performance remains a problem for us.  For example:


# On the planning board I am looking at a context resulting in three pages of cards.  Not that much.
# I click the clock to add work to one of the cards, enter the details and click Add.
# I wait ten seconds while the dial spins
# Page seems to refresh completely.

This happens for most any operation.  Not sure what you can do, but it seems that if the versions panel for example needs to be updated with total hours remaining etc. it could be done independently from the rest of the cards.  So updating a single card could mean that card is redrawn and the versions panel is redrawn, but everything else remains active.
fields.summary: Performance: do not refresh the entire page when updating a card if you can avoid it

BTW it is strange that when you create the Greenhooper Rank custom field, it has a Serach Template of 'Number Searcher' but it seems to do nothing.
fields.summary: Allow searching on a Jira Rank

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The end date shown in the Chart Board above the chart is one day behind the date that the burn down guide line terminates at.

They should match.

I assume this relates to [GHS-24|http://www.greenpeppersoftware.com/jira/browse/GHS-24] and [GHS-442|http://www.greenpeppersoftware.com/jira/browse/GHS-442].

Note: The downloadable CSV data confuses this still further by listing hours logged against day X as being against day X+1 which is wrong. This is because, presumably, the date indicated in the CSV column header is actually showing the hours logged at 00:00 on day X+1, rather than hours logged from 00:00-23:59:59 on day X.
fields.summary: Chart end date does not match burndown guideline end date.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Filtering by an individual shows the total time accumulated as being accumulated by whoever is currently assigned to the issue. It would be nice to see only the time the specified individual(s) contributed on that day/to that issue.

This ticket is an improvement request for a means of showing just the hours the individual(s) actually contributed.
fields.summary: Filtering a chart by individual should show actual hours contributed by *that* individual

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Our developers expect to see the hours they burned against the *date* they did the work, but the hour burndown chart (when dates instead of days are shown on the x-axis) shows the work against the following day because it indicates the hours done at 00:00 on the specified date.

This ticket is a request for an improvement to be able to show the hours accumulated on the date, i.e. 00:00-23:59:59 inclusive, and not just the hours accumulated as of 00:00.
fields.summary: Show time burned on the date burned, not on the following day.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Displaying or close an issue from Greenhopper using the JIRA Iframe setting is too slow - maybe due to the painting and drawing that occur?  Specically if I am in planning board or task board and I need to click on the issue number to see it or edit it it seems:
- Greenhopper takes a long time to display the issue - much longer than w/o the IFrame.  It is especially painful from remote desktop since the screen seems to repaint several times to dim the background items, then draw the frame and then fill in the frame with the issue.
- Greenhopper takes a long time to close the issue once displayed.  Many seconds to dismiss an issue is really painful.  Once again a lot of painting of the screen occurs.

Is there a better way?  We don't want to resort to using browser tabs.  Seems other web 2.0 apps can display pop ups much faster w/o repainting with some clever AJAX.  Maybe greenhopper can do something similar.  Thanks for considering :)   People are really complaining loudly about the painting performance and wind up using Jira's issue navigator and only using Greenhopper when they must (e.g. for ranking or graphs) - we hope to get a solution.
fields.summary: Performance of displaying and closing issues from greenhopper in JIRA Iframe is too slow

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
on jira.atlassian.com we were getting a lot of "Could not find issue with id null" exceptions in our logs and couldn't quite work out where they were coming from.

In our recent analysis of JAC stability we noticed thatthere were GreenHopper requests like {{/secure/GetBoardForIssue.jspa?decorator=none&selectedProjectId=10470&selectedVersionId=13741&type=TB&id=&id=57153}} where there are two *id* parameters and the first one is empty. This was a cause.

We were running a 2.0 (for 3.10) version. The "Go to Planning Board" links on this site don't have this problem so I assume it has been fixed, but I tried to search for another report and couldn't find one. Please close if this is duplicate.
fields.summary: Go to Planning/Task Board links contain duplicate id parameter in URL

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
This is linked to the fact that these pages are quite expensive to produce and don't make a lot of sense being indexed anyway. We would probably like the ability to add {{nofollow}} to the links and {{<META NAME="ROBOTS" CONTENT="NOODP">}} to the pages themselves (a "Discourage indexers" option?).

We are adding GreenHopper links to our robots.txt
fields.summary: Need the ability to hide Task Board and Planning Board links from anonymous users (well, spiders in particular)

fields.summary: Treat required fields the same way as Jira

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The StepBoard contained in the request maintains a {{List}} of {{Issue}} objects (the result of a search, so {{DocumentIssueImpl}} instances in practice). This list can get very large if the issues happen to contain any large fields such as environment or description. On http://jira.atlassian.com we have seen OutOfMemoryError heap dumps that have contained 300MB of StepBoard instance retained memory - and 600MB of {{Document}} instance retained memory (which is mostly stack-local, we haven't worked out what stack frames own this yet).

As we are not familiar with the code, we aren't sure why this is implemented in this way, but it is a potentially unbound resource use that does not scale well at all. Please consider limiting the results via a {{PagerFilter}}.
fields.summary: High memory usage of request local StepBoard

fields.description: If you have a fix version which contains unresolved issues and you "Release" the fix version GH prompts you to choose a fix version to migrate the issues to. If you have the required Resolve Issue or Schedule Issue permission (depends on whether or not you have ticked "Need Scheduling Permission") this works fine, but if you do not have this permission GH silently fails to migrate the issues and the fix version disappears from your planning board so unless you have your eyes open you won't notice that the issues haven't appeared in the fix version they were supposed to move to!
fields.summary: GH silently fails to move issues out of fix version on release if required permission is not assigned

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Right now the page numbers in the planning and task board are only at the top of the page.  So if you scroll down to the bottom of a page to look at the last issue shown, and then want to go the next page, you need to scroll to the top of the page to click the page number.  This is especially annoying when re-ranking new issues that arrive at the bottom of your backlog.

By also having the page number links at the bottom of the page I can quickly click to move to the next page, or quickly drag an item from the bottom of the last page to a new page number without scrolling or dragging the issue all the way to the top of the page.

Hopefully a really simple fix that will be a big time saver :)
fields.summary: Page #s should be at the top and bottom of page to speed moving issues between pages

fields.description:
We have broken our development into 3 phases:  Pre-programming (design), Programming, Post-Programming (QA / Testing).  

After the design phase, the ticket will stay in a status "Approved for Programming" until scheduled.  Once scheduled for a release with the planning board, it would be nice to drill down a layer and then assign the programming task to programmers with drag and drop.

A couple of Use case issues to consider.  I don't need or want the whole universe of assignable people.  Being able to limit this to a specific group (or groups) would be nice.  Having it automatically change status too might be a nice touch.  On assignment, set status to: .  In our case "Review Requirements".
fields.summary: Once a task is scheduled to a release, it would be nice to be able to drag and drop for assignments.

fields.description:
Rank should be cleared because it is only meaningful within a single project.  Rank values should be cleared when moving issues between projects so that it behaves (from a ranking perspective) like the newly moved issue was just entered and is hence at the bottom of the backlog.  Otherwise it may be thrown anywhere in the target project's overall ranking which is misleading.

iI do not think this is something I can workaround via a custom workflow, is it?
fields.summary: The Rank field should be cleared when an issue is moved between projects

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

Log in as user "Myself"

Go to the Task Board
Switch on Auto Assign

In the "In Progress" list, pick an issue in progress assigned to another user "SomebodyElse"

Drag the issue to the "Done" column

See : Confirmation Dialog, asking whether to Resolve/Close/Cancel

Click on Cancel

See : Issue remains in the "In Progress" Column

Assignee seems to still be "SomebodyElse" - but that's not the case - the assigne has been changed to "MySelf" despite the cancelation

Refresh the Browser

See : Assignee is "Myself"  
(Expected : Assigned is "SomebodyElse")

A canceled operation should not change the Database.

Running Greenhopper version 2.3.1-jira37
fields.summary: Autoassign changes assignee even when workflow operation is canceled

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently the GH burndown chart does not show the stories added or removed after the initial plan.  So if a sprint starts with several issues that comprise 16 story points (their committment), and then halfway into the sprint, the team decides to add 1 issue w/4 story points from the backlog, GH will redraw the graph in a way that shows the original committment as 20 story points, which actually the graph should reflect that 4 story points were added 1/2 way into the sprint.  

This is misleading because id a team took on more they should get more credit for it or it can be used to help understand "why did our plan change" 

Jeff Sutherland showed us how to do this in Scrum (which is also how some google teams do it) by showing a "Change in Committment" line to the story point Burndown chart.  The Committement line stays at 0 if there are no changes, but goes down (into negative territory) if story points get added, and goes up if story points are dropped.  GH would no longer redraw graphs with the line moving from 16 story points at the beginning to 20 points at the beginning if 4 points were added - rather GH would just draw the graph starting from the 16 points all the way down to -4 points.  This keeps the ideal line intact as well as the original committment.  See the I attached.
fields.summary: Add a "Change in Committment" line to story point Burndown chart to show a change in committment (adds/drops)

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I was wondering how you would recommend capturing the burndown chart at the end of a failed sprint. I would like the chart to reflect those issues that are not completed at the end of a sprint, but if I move them to Fix For a subsequent sprint release then they will no longer be represented on the burndown chart of the failed sprint as incomplete tasks, with a remaining estimate >0. Also, I don't really want to mark this Fix For version as released at the end of the failed sprint, but there seens to be no other possible resolution to close the version and finalise the chart.

I was wondering whether you have any recommendations for this situation.

Cheers,
Steven
fields.summary: How to capture the burndown chart for a failed sprint?

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
To see the history of rank changes and do auditing, we need to see when someone changes the Rank of an item in Greenhopper.  I know that maybe changing Rank can cause other ranks to change and that could generate a ton of history changes, but I really at least need to see when I drag and drop change the rank of any 1 item.  Possible?
This is similar to what was mentioned GHS-270.
fields.summary: Need to be able to show changes to Rank in Jira history

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The field type of the column *value* in the *porpertytext* table is a VARCHAR2 (4000 char) in the Oracle database.

The Contexts value can be much larger then this thus, when updating the value, Oracle will throw an exception. In order to be able to add more then one context this field type have to be altered.

In order to achieve this we have written a complete and safe [how to|http://www.greenpeppersoftware.com/confluence/display/GH/JIRA+Upgrade+for+Oracle]
Make sure you follow it *{color:blue}step by step{color}*

If you have any questions please feel free to contact me directly.

[JC Huet|mailto:jchuet@pyxis-tech.com]
fields.summary: Stacktrace while using the contexts on oracle 10g

You need to select the empty versions to see the stats filled correctly.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Imagine you have added the GH portlet twice to the same dashboard page, perhaps because you want to view the portlet in two different states, e.g. the first showing one fix version and the second showing another fix version, or a daily view, or a story point view, etc.

Currently this is not possible because each time you reload the dashboard both instances of the portlet choose the same default fix version and view settings.
fields.summary: Remember portlet settings

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Add tooltips (e.g. title tags) for the words "GHS-279", "6 Subs", and "Comment" that said something like "View this issue in Jira", "List the sub issues", and "Add a comment".  Currently when you hover over these links they don't say anything other than "Double click to view summary" - which makes sense if you were hovering over the card, but actually is wrong if you are hovering over these links
fields.summary: Add tooltips for IssueKey, Subs and Comment link.

fields.summary: Accessing GreenHopper results in HTTP Status 404 - Could not execute action [PlanningBoard]

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Add the possibility to display dates in burndown charts, on the Days axis

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Like many product owners, I need to see my backlog of work (bugs, stories, etc) prioritized from top to bottom for all unreleased versions.  I can't plan future releases by puttingt them into Jira versions because if I do, there is no way to see a single top to bottom rank across all unreleased versions in the GH planning board (you can only see the items within a particular version or parent version and the ranking across versions is not clear).  

The only way to do that today it seems is to have *all* backlog items assigned to the *unscheduled* version until they are committed to a sprint (in which case the team uses the planning board to drag as many items as they can from the top of the ranked *unscheduled* version to the appropriate version/sprint. 

Then in the planning board, shown in list view (which is wonderful!), what I do is create tasks that say "Items shown above this task are for Version 1.5" and farther down on the ranked list I create a task that says "Items shown above this task are for Version 2.0" , etc.  When I want to plan releases to another I simply drag one item higher or lower to than the special "Version tasks" in the ranking.  Another benefit is that I create a task that says "Items shown below this task have to be reviewed" to allow me to see at a glance all items that have come in that I need to consider dragging to a higher rank.

What I'd like to see instead is that for every Jira unrelease version, that Greenhopper's planning board shows an item that represents the Jira unreleased version (e.g. Version 1.5) - so that I don't need to create the tasks that I described above.  With that I can see a top to bottom ranking, and by dragging an item above or below a Jira version item, I will be automatically setting the Jira Fix Version/s field.  This would be wonderful.  Items assigned to versions would not disspear from the view like they do now and I could see all items in 1 ranked view.  This would ALSO unifiy the rank field with the Fix Version/s field, which is great, since by definition, items in 1 earlier version should have a lower rank than items planned for later versions.

Make sense?  BTW doing this would basically simulate www.ScrumWorks.com planning board, which i think is one of the best ones around....also it would simulate the best practices for maintaining product backlogs in a single spreadsheet ala what Scrum creators like Jeff Sutherland reccomend.
fields.summary: Better support for planning a Backlog ranked from top to bottom

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We have 10 Jira projects that are all working on common versions, sprints, etc.  All of our sprints start / stop on the same date, etc.  When we release a new version of our product, we ship to the customer the results of 6-8 sprints worth of work in 1 deliverable from all of 10 of these Jira projects.

Currently there is no way to get "rolled up" burn down graphs for the common Jira versions these separate projects are working on.  It would be great if:

1.  At a minimum, I could get access to the raw data that is used to draw the burn down / burn up graphs for both released and unreleased versions so I could draw my own consolidated "master release" graphs from all 10 projects.   Could you expose the data as XLS or CSV files in some directory on the Jira server or expose links so I can save them as needed to disk and then load them into excel and do a roll up graph?
2.  Even better (but I'll settle for #1), could I tell Greenhopper the list of Jira projects it should consider when drawing a consolidated release charts?  I would name all of my versions the same across all projects so that the roll up can make sense of the data.

This would be very useful - without it the only release planning we can do is on a project by project basis, and not for a master project.
fields.summary: Support Cross-Project Release Burndown / BurnUp charts

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Make the textbox with the dates in the chart board editable

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Ability to subscribe to the download page so that we ca get notified of a new release

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
If I arrange my versions so that I have a release master version and a sprint child version when I drag a card on the planning board from the release to the sprint the card reappears in the release (because it now has two fix versions, the master and the child).

If I have several sprints and I just want to view the issues assigned to the release but not yet assigned to a sprint I don't appear to be able to because I can't find a way to highlight, filter or order by the fix version.

Quite frustrating and confusing.
fields.summary: Unintuitive master <-> child card visibility

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
* On the Planning Board select Overview from the drop down (Overview, Versions, Components).
* Select a Custom Context
* Pick a sort field that is actually a GreenHopper ranking sort type
* Switch to list view mode
* Drag-n-drop the issues - this works, except you cannot drag the top issue (the mouse changes to an action not allowed shape) and you cannot drag any other issue into the top position.
fields.summary: Cannot re-order top item in list mode on the planning board overview

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Our team uses the Resolved / Fixed Resolution to indicate an issue that has not been fully tested but is ready to be fully tested.  The Closed status indicates that it has been fully tested.  Currently in GreenHopper, Resolved / Fixed issues 
1) count in the story point burn up
2) when the version is released, those issues are not moved into the next release.

This causes us major problems because we do NOT want to count issues that have not been fully tested as story points earned, and of course we want them moved to the next release because if they were not tested in this release, they need to go into the next release.

So to summarize, for Issues with:

1.	Status: Resolved
2.	Resolution: Fixed

We want GreenHopper to:
1.	Move them with other "Unresolved" issues during the Release Process
2.	Not include their Story Points in the Charts as done 

Make sense?  Or should this be handled another way.
fields.summary: Need GreenHopper to handle Resolved & Fixed issues differently than other Resolved issues

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: the last row is outside the summary card
fields.summary: UI bug in the summary cards in Safari

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We are a german company but our corporate language is english.
After upgrading from 2.1.1 to 2.2 Greenhopper appears in german language, but the jira itself appears in english language.

I assume Greenhopper uses the language from the browser or from the OS instead of jira default language.

Could you fix that please.

Thanks and best regards
Michael
fields.summary: Internationalisation, cannot switch to english language after upgrading from 2.1.1 to 2.2

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
* On the Planning Board make sure you are viewing the Default context
* Click the pencil in the top left corner (with hover text 'View - Edit context')
* The popup window that appears contains the text 'Assigne To me' which presumably should be 'Assigned to me'.
fields.summary: Typo: "Assigne To me" in the default context popup window

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: * Add a Multi User Picker custom field to Jira * In the Planning Board do Configuration -> Cards * Drag your Multi User Picker field from the Available Fields to the card * Go back to the Planning Board * Find a card and double click it to show the detailed view * Click the pencil icon next to the Multi User Picker field * You should see this raw HTML: (in my case the field value was already set to 'admin' from the Issue Navigator edit issue interface) Admin
fields.summary: HTML revealed when editing Multi User Picker field that has been added to a card layout
